009
010package imagingbook.common.edges;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Monochromatic edge detector, applicable to color images ({@link ColorProcessor}) only.
024 * See Sec. 16.2 (Alg. 16.1) of [1] for additional details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
028 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2014/02/16
033 * @version 2022/09/04 converted to implement interface
034 * @version 2022/09/11 changed to 2D kernel arrays using IjUtils
035 */
036public class MonochromaticEdgeDetector implements EdgeDetector {
037
038        private final int M;    // image width
039        private final int N;    // image height
040        private final FloatProcessor Emag;      // edge magnitude map
041        private final FloatProcessor Eort;      // edge orientation map
042
043        // Sobel-kernels for x/y-derivatives:
044    private static final float[][] HxS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[][] {
045                        {-1, 0, 1},
046                    {-2, 0, 2},
047                    {-1, 0, 1}});
048
049    private static final float[][] HyS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[][] {
050                        {-1, -2, -1},
051                        { 0,  0,  0},
052                        { 1,  2,  1}});
053
054        
055        public MonochromaticEdgeDetector(ColorProcessor cp) {
056                this.M = cp.getWidth();
057                this.N = cp.getHeight();
058                this.Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
059                this.Eort = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
060                findEdges(cp);
061        }
062        
063        private void findEdges(ColorProcessor cp) {
064                FloatProcessor[] I = new PixelPack(cp).getFloatProcessors();
065            FloatProcessor[] Ix = new FloatProcessor[3];
066            FloatProcessor[] Iy = new FloatProcessor[3];
067            
068                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
069                        Ix[k] = I[k];
070                        Iy[k] = (FloatProcessor) Ix[k].duplicate();
071                        IjUtils.convolve(Ix[k], HxS);
072                        IjUtils.convolve(Iy[k], HyS);
073                }
074
075                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
076                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
077                                // extract the gradients of the R, G, B channels:
078                                double rx = Ix[0].getf(u, v), ry = Iy[0].getf(u, v);
079                                double gx = Ix[1].getf(u, v), gy = Iy[1].getf(u, v);
080                                double bx = Ix[2].getf(u, v), by = Iy[2].getf(u, v);
081                                
082                                double er2 = sqr(rx) + sqr(ry);
083                                double eg2 = sqr(gx) + sqr(gy);
084                                double eb2 = sqr(bx) + sqr(by);
085                                
086                                // assign local edge magnitude:
087                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt(er2 + eg2 + eb2));
088                                
089                                // find the maximum gradient channel:
090                                double e2max = er2, cx = rx, cy = ry;   // assume red is the max channel                        
091                                if (eg2 > e2max) {
092                                        e2max = eg2; cx = gx; cy = gy;          // green is the max channel
093                                }
094                                if (eb2 > e2max) {
095                                        e2max = eb2; cx = bx; cy = by;          // blue is the max channel
096                                }
097                                
098                                // calculate edge orientation angle for the maximum channel:
099                                Eort.setf(u, v, (float) Math.atan2(cy, cx));
100                        }
101                }
102        }
103        
104        @Override
105        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
106                return Emag;
107        }
108
109        @Override
110        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
111                return Eort;
112        }
113        
114}
